alert.note: Alert for Clay; Northwest Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 9:34PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Nicholas and southeastern Clay Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 933 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Clay, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Birch River, Craigsville, Widen, Calvin, Drennan and Muddlety. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 43 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
